title: What's this 62 Double Crew Cab Splitty worth?

posts.content: Looking to buy this 1962 VW Crew cab. It runs like a dream and the horn and all electrics work. Brakes are good and it runs as good as any bus I've been in. It does however have some rust. The sills and the front of the bed have rust. Floor pans need doing and the bottom of the nose is bubbling. Battery tray also. It's always been in California and the current owner has had it 30 years! What do you think it's worth in the good old UK? It comes with the complete back seat and all the windows. Gates have a bit of rust at the bottom.

Somewhere around £5K GBP( possibly up to £6K if someone`s keen) as it sits, but already imported into the U.K.

P.S - That truck is a 63 model, not a 62
That's a nice looking DC. I reckon you'd get someone keen enought at £6k. There's a couple that have sat on fleebay nearer the 10k price tag. This is in as good a condition as those IMHO.

The Flying Scotvan wrote:
That's a nice looking DC. I reckon you'd get someone keen enought at £6k. There's a couple that have sat on fleebay nearer the 10k price tag. This is in as good a condition as those IMHO.


With the amount of welding/paint repair required, plus MOT work/registration etc, there`s not a hope in hell of achieving anything close to £10K for that truck.

Sweet Rides wrote:
The Flying Scotvan wrote:
That's a nice looking DC. I reckon you'd get someone keen enought at £6k. There's a couple that have sat on fleebay nearer the 10k price tag. This is in as good a condition as those IMHO.


With the amount of welding/paint repair required, plus MOT work/registration etc, there`s not a hope in hell of achieving anything close to £10K for that truck.


You seem to have misunderstood my post. I said I reckoned you might get someone keen enough at £6k - not £10k (which was a comparison with other trucks being flogged for too high a price).

Go for it 68nun. You'll not regret owning one of these. They're the ultimate utility VW.

reckon that as it is 6k is fair,If you got a Tisclher? demountable camper on it 20k!had a thought on trying somthing like it but finding a demountable that would fit is the problem ,and the power to weight ,suspension etc.. Silly idea but I am a silly person .

My only thoughts are trying to maybe find a dryer Double Cab. I'm not a welder and it needs:
new floor pans
new inner and outer sills
new bed where it meets the cab
battery pan
bottoms of gates
replace a twisted jacking point
and then of course it will need paint.

I've just sold one in much worse condition (cab floor, sills and lhd A post totally gone, no engine, but solid apart from that than that) for 5K and I have one for sale as a rolling chassis with all of the welding done for 8K (not original paint - respayed over 25 years ago with nice patina). There have been a few sold recently, SA, lowered with non stock, with upgraded performance engines for 15K mark

http://www.ssvc.org.uk/phpbb/viewtopic.php?f=51&t=67479

Good DC's are in my opinion starting to rise in value as they are cooler than a cool thing and have many uses etc and are getting rare (as most have been through a hard life)

wellard wrote:

I agree with the dc values going up. Well I hope I'm right anyway, I bought a SA RHD DC last year for a little over 17k (neg down from 18.5k!). 1776, airbags, brms, restored a few years back. They are rare, well especially the RHD ones. DCs are cool mate, go for it. 5-6k sounds good to me, when I was looking a couldn't find anything that was full of holes for less the 10-12k.
